metadata.titel_preek: How to Dress for a Wedding

locutie.beschrijving: Exegesis of the Parable of the Wedding Feast, exploring cultural hospitality, the nature of God's invitation, and the 'wedding garment' as putting on Christ.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Integrates historical context of hospitality and cross-references Isaiah, Galatians, and Revelation effectively.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of God's kingdom and explaining the parable, with a shift toward promising and inviting in the conclusion.
voorbeelden: The kingdom of heaven may be compared to a king...
God is going to have his party whether you and I are there or not.
It is your own personal invitation to joy.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To make the hearer feel the urgency and joy of the invitation, leading to a 'putting on' of Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The Spirit is not explicitly named as the agent of the 'event', though the 'promise' is highlighted.

voorbeelden: The Bible is full of imagery about parties.
This is not an ordinary wedding.
Let us cast off the works of darkness.
Iâ€™ll never forget my first Bar Mitzvah.
I am ashamed to tell you that I was utterly chagrined.
The promise is that those loved ones will be with us.
It is your own personal invitation to joy.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong in content but often framed as a description of a promise rather than the act of promising itself.

voorbeelden: Blessed are those who are invited.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate; relies heavily on quoting scripture to perform the declaration.

indicatoren: Extensive storytelling about personal experiences (Opera, Bar Mitzvah).
Long sections explaining what a 'really good party' is like.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of the preacher's insights rather than a participant in the event.

missende_elementen: Direct present-tense 'I promise you on behalf of God'
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' is delayed until the very end of the sermon.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The promise is framed as a 'declaration of grace' but remains somewhat descriptive.
voorbeelden: It is your own personal invitation to joy, an unimaginable declaration of grace to every one of us.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation, mostly in the final third.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the invitation to the hearer.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the parable, the king, and the guests.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance where the hearer 'watches' the parable.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about God and parties.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (Explanation of parable) to Commissive (The promise of the feast) to Directive (Rejoice).
voorbeelden: The promise is... it is your personal invitation... rejoice!
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is late but effective.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because it is a free welcome (Indicative), rejoice (Imperative).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon focuses on the grace of the invitation and the joy of the gospel, but spends a significant amount of time 'talking about' the concept of parties.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: It is your own personal invitation to joy.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates a sense of personal belonging.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Long descriptions of the Metropolitan Opera and Bar Mitzvahs.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Distracts from the illocutionary urgency of the text.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event in the final two paragraphs, but the preceding sections are largely informative/anecdotal.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: It points to the Eucharist as a foretaste but doesn't fully 'perform' the presence of Christ in the speaking itself until the very end.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the preacher's use of the 'invitation'.
tekstueel_bewijs: For those who have ears to hear, it is your own personal invitation.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's 'ears to hear'.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, explicitly linked to the Eucharist.
tekstueel_bewijs: A foretaste of the day when the Lord will inaugurate the perfect party.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'was' (assertive/constative). It needs more 'I give' and 'God promises' (commissive/declarative).

specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God extends this grace to you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a historical fact to a present event.

toezegging_verversterking.probleem: The promise is described as a concept rather than delivered as a gift.
toezegging_verversterking.suggestie: Use more direct 'I' address on behalf of Christ.
voorbeeldzinnen: In the name of Christ, I tell you: the garment is yours.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time in the 3rd person describing the parable.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave the 'you' into the narrative of the parable.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the one standing in the street when the King's servant finds you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually good, just needs more performative weight.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A beautifully written sermon with high literary quality that would benefit from shifting its weight from 'talking about' the party to 'ushering the guests in'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's self-revelation (the opera story); SAT focuses on whether that story hinders or helps the illocutionary act of God's promise.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric admires the 'party' metaphor; SAT asks if the metaphor actually 'invites' the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the final 10%, suggesting the 'constative surplus' of the first 90% could be trimmed to allow the 'event' more space.

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Low - describes God's character without addressing the hearer.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: It is your own personal invitation to joy.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - performs the act of inviting.

appendices.notities: The sermon is homiletically 'warm' but linguistically 'constative' for the majority of its duration.
